text: A lockdown will result in less coronavirus deaths but an economic shutdown can “kill people through alcoholism, drug abuse, opioid overdoses, depression... people needed a heart or kidney or other kinds of treatment, it puts them at risk,” says top WH trade adviser Peter Navarro https://t.co/SRgA0vMZq8
